item.item: This attribute holds the unique identifier of the site.
Whether any monitoring of the site is foreseen across years.
Name of person or entity in charge of the monitoring.
Authority file to which the habitat refers.
National habitat unit authority file version
Other conserved area, not protected by legislation
World Database of Protected Areas code
World Database of Protected Areas unique site code (WDPA) ( source: http://www.wdpa.org/).
Description of the geomorphology of the immediate surroundings of the collecting site (adapted from FAO, 1990).
Bottom position in flat or almost-flat terrain.
Estimated slope of the site in degrees.
The direction that the slope faces, with symbols N, S, E, W (e.g. a slope that faces a south-western direction has an aspect of SW).
Moisture conditions prevailing in the soil.
Actual measurement of soil acidity at related depth.
Depth in centimetres at which soil acidity condition was recorded.
Actual measurement of soil salinity in ppm at related depth.
Depth in centimetres at which soil salinity condition was recorded.

This attribute holds the location elevation in meters, positive values indicate above the sea level and negative values indicate below sea level. For areas, this attribute should hold the mean elevation.
This attribute holds the location minimum elevation in meters, positive values indicate above the sea level and negative values indicate below sea level.
This attribute holds the location maximum elevation in meters, positive values indicate above the sea level and negative values indicate below sea level.
This attribute holds the location elevation uncertainty in meters, positive values indicate above the sea level and negative values indicate below sea level.

Datum of the projection used to obtain the coordinates. If not provided ‘WGS 1984’ will be used. A horizontal geodetic datum based on an ellipsoid that has its origin at the earth's center of mass. Examples are the World Geodetic System of 1984, the North American Datum of 1983, and the Geodetic Datum of Australia of 1994. The first uses the WGS84 ellipsoid; the latter two use the GRS80 ellipsoid.
Equatorial radius minus the specified datum Equatorial radius in meters
The WGS-84 flattening minus the specified datum flattening multiplied by 10^4
WGS-84 X minus the specified datum X
WGS-84 Y minus the specified datum Y
WGS-84 Z minus the specified datum Z
Ordnance Survey of Great Britain '36, Airy
This attribute holds the location latitude in decimal degrees.
This attribute holds the location latitude as it was provided.
This attribute holds the location latitude degrees.
This attribute holds the location latitude minutes.
This attribute holds the location latitude seconds.
This attribute holds the location latitude hemisphere, accepted values are N for North and S for South.
This attribute holds the location latitude uncertainty in meters.
This attribute holds the location longitude in decimal degrees.
This attribute holds the location longitude as it was provided.
This attribute holds the location longitude degrees.
This attribute holds the location longitude minutes.
This attribute holds the location longitude seconds.
This attribute holds the location longitude hemisphere, accepted values are E for East and W for West.
This attribute holds the location longitude uncertainty in meters.
The upper limit of the distance (in meters) from the given latitude and longitude describing a circle within which the whole of the described locality must lie (Radius).
This type qualifies the method by which the coordinates were recorded or calculated.
A flag indicating restriction in making the geographical coordinates publically available.
This attribute indicates whether the coordinates may or may not be published.
